sourceDesc.p: The original source for this dataset is a database dump by the Bodleian Libraries at .

org.note: Printed & published J Parry (31-5); Parry & Son (35-9); J & J Parry (40-7); Thomas Thomas (47)>
Appears to be work of John Parry
Will dated 25/9/1616 proved at York Vol 34/267
Possibly related to Mrs Jane Yallowley

address.addrLine: 50 Mount Pleasant. Upper Birket St. St Annes St. 88 Mount Pleasant. Lord St

org.note: In Edinburgh as a conductor (by 1815); retired (c1817). Imprints (1802-5). Premises in Preston & Liverpool taken over by John Green, of London (1815-48). Part with Green & Weiss. Suceeded by Weiss & Felix Yaniewicz jr (1805b-1886d). Dental surgeon (?)
Part Felix Yaniewicz & Willoughby Gaspar Weiss. James Smith an assistant
Probably related to William Yapp. Announced opening of stationery & toy warehouse 22/10/1851 in former premises of (father?) Samuel Yapp.
Parish Clerk of St peter's. Depot of Society for Christian Knowledge at his shop. Related to (possibly father) Mary Anne & Harriett Yapp

(1830-8; invented Yapp's Aperient antibilious pills); tea etc.dealer (1838-42); Bible whse (1842-53) etc. Moved to London as religious publisher; Yapp bindings originally produced to his specification. Bible & tract depository.

address.addrLine: 2 New Inn Passage. Clement's Inn Passage, Clare Mkt

org.note: Took in advts for `Johnson's British Gazette' 1785
Widow Richard Yardley. Presented var apprentices 1597-1604

address.addrLine: Houghton St (1777). Clare Mkt (1777). New Inn Passage, Clare Mkt (1777)

org.note: Associate of Ed Ring Alford, toymkr. SFIP 388611 (1777)

address.addrLine: The Star, on Broad Street Hill

org.note: Apprenticed to R Jugge. Possibly freed in 1575. With P Short took over ptng materials of Henry Denham. Possibly 1593d
See William Ratcliffe, William Lamburd, William Hayes

address.addrLine: Duke St, St James's. 14 Duke St. 34 Bury St, St James's

org.note: Trading as Yarrell & Jones (1801-6); Jones & Yarrell (1808-42). Part W Jones. SFIP 381180 (1777)
See Jones & Yarrell. By appointment to the Royal family.
Son-in-law of R Bacon; partner of Bacon & R Chase 3 (1785-8); subsequently with Bacon only (1775-94)
Apprenticed to Thomas Gent 1745; free 1752. Son of Joseph Yarrow, gentleman
Probably the same as William Yarrow.
Licensed Victualler. ? Charles Yarrow. Probably the same as W Yarrow.
Born Farnsworth, Lancs. Children born Little Lever and Eagley Bridge

address.addrLine: Leadenhall St (1763-5). 94/95 Leadenhall St (1767-72). 104 Leadenhall St (1774)
King of Clubs, Windmill Hill Row, Moorfields

org.note: Apprentices: Thomas Maddison (1727); John Atkinson (1733); Thomas Roylands (1733); John Barnes (1740/1); Thomas Brock (1741); John Pickersgill (1748). Address from Goodall's additional list, which extends date to 1799 (unlikely?)
Mill tenant. Trading as Yates, Wiles & Beattie until 28/6/1839 when Yates left partnership
Apprenticed to Thomas Barton (binding 25.7.1719 & payment 20.3.1720 - Inland Revenue Records IR/1/46/82).
master of Thomas(son) 1783. master of William THompson 1788. part son Thomas 1803
father & son. Previously on own accounts. master of James Tandy 1803
Aged 15 yr; brother of Thomas Yates; born Preston

address.addrLine: 51 Park Rd (42). 25 Crown St & L Pembroke Pl (47)

org.note: Printed & published `Bolton Express' (Saturday). Sold pamphlet printed by David Marples of Liverpool 1824
WING C373. Took payment for Camden's `Britannia' (1693)
Trading as Yates & Co (to 1805); Yates & Hess (1797?-1850)
Succeeeded by Ed Bunn, chemist & bkslr, by 1855
Aged 14 yr, brother of Henry Leigh Yates; born Preston
Apprenticed to Henry Yates(father) 1783. part father Henry 1803.
Working card maker. Apprentice: Thomas Newman (1789).

address.addrLine: Windmill Hill Row, Moorfields. 174 Aldersgate St

org.note: See Ed Yates & Joseph Barnes. Apprentice: Francis Harding (1773). Bankrupt 1776
Mill tenant. Part G J Yates, G Wiles & R Beattie diss notice `London Gazette' 28/6/1839. Succeeeded by Beattie & Co
Textwriter. Also Ibot. Warden of Mistery of Limners & Scriveners (1416)
German or Dutch origin. Part William Gardner 1770>. Surveyor to Duke of Richmond 1758-82. Chief Draughtsman, Board of Ordnance at Tower. Father of Thomas Yeakell II
Son of Thomas Yeakell I. Employed at Board of Ordnance 1787-93
Marriage Lic to Joan Lucas of Hastings All Saints maiden
Journeyman on `Bristol Gazette'. Father of Chapel 1838
father Thomas, apprenticed to John Hurst 1712
Apprenticed to John Hurst 1712. son Thomas, Chipping Wickham, currier

address.addrLine: 79 John St, Tottenham Court Rd. 109 New Bond St

org.note: Pupil of Valentine Green. Probably died young
Born DEV. Married Ann, b DEV 1809; ch b DEV 1837-48
Trading as Clarke & Yellowley (1792-1824); Yellowley & Clarke (1825-31)

address.addrLine: Fore St (1701). High St (1704). O/a St Martin's La, High St (1707)

org.note: Apprenticed to Robert Eveleigh. Exeter freeman 1682. WING P3734/D2646/C373/T1135. Took subscriptions for various publications 1691-5. Succeeded by son Philip in partnership with Mrs Margery Yeo
Sold game to John Murray I [Letter from JMI to Yeo 9/11/1786]

bapt of children at Thornton Dale

Widow Charles Yetsweirt. 10 imprints 1595-7. Law patent passed to Thomas Wight & Bonham Norton

Printed catalogue for auction of Rev Richard Fry's furniture (1785)
Will dated 16/11/1558 proved at York Vol 15/3/191

Deighton & moxon, publishers. printed on Saturdays.
Known only from `The Hocus Pocus' no 2, printed for the proprietors

org.note: Paper sorter. Wife of John Young

address.addrLine: Blue Bible in Covent Gdn. Shop in Bedford St in Covent Gdn nr the New Exchange (1640)

org.note: Not member StatCo. Possibly the same as the M Young bound to William Sheares in 1631 & never freed
Bro-in-law of Henry Whitmore. Born Manchester
Based at Wootton Wawen but also at Aston Cantlow Mills. Part William & Daniel Righton trading as Messrs Righton & Young c1802. Probably succeeded by Rd Younge
Based at Wootton Wawen. Trading as Messrs Righton & Young c1802

address.addrLine: At the Star on Bread Street Hill (1629-41?)

org.note: Apprenticed to & part Humphrey Lownes. Agent in Dublin for Irish Stock. King's printer, Scotland. Assoc R Badger sr. Royalist

org.note: Apprenticed to Thomas Cheesman; free Merchant Taylors' Co. Master of William Mattingly (1792>); John Pickett (1795>)
Wife of Peter Young. Born Manchester

address.addrLine: Nr the Gt Door of St Paul's

org.note: Freed as Draper by J Wight in 1584. Transferred from Drapers' to StatCo in 1600. Assoc R Jackson sr
Successor to Samuel & Joseph Millbourn. Insured utensils etc.in 1770 (SFIP 280145). Mill to let, late occupied by William Young, in 1778. Mill passed to William & George Ward by 1781

org.note: Probate inventory lists primers, child's guides, grammars, Gk grammars & Latin bks for sale (1680)
Born Berdmondsey. Son-in-law of Richard Wheeler
Son of John of Uppingham, innkeeper. Apprenticed to George Daniell.
Successor to E Broomfield. Emigrated to Melbourne Australia (1845)

address.addrLine: Market End St (1812). Market St (1814). Market Pl (1826-51)

org.note: ins (Suffolk & General County). Registered press Nov 1812
Registered press 12/4/1830, witness: Joseph Y. See Philip Y. J Omer previously & J Porter subsq at address
Published Thomas Cromwell's `History & Description of Colchester' (1825). Probably the same as Philip Youngman
Of Witham. Registered press in Maldon February 1804 for printing in both places; again Nov 1806 (witness G Y)
Part I Marsden, Colchester March 1802. Registered own press in Maldon February 1804 for printing in both places
He may be the same as the Philip Youngman, bookseller of Chatham (1832-4). Also in Maldon (1805-19)
Also in Witham. ?same as P Youngman, Chatham. Sold T K Cromwell's `Excursions in Suffolk' (1818-19)
Possibly related to Meadows Youngman. Possibly same as P Youngman in Witham & Maldon
Registered press May 1826. Son of Philip Youngman; succeeded on father's bankruptcy
Possibly the same as or related to John Priestley of High Holborn
Paper importer. Surname uncertain. Imported `iij Rymbes albi papri' in Dec 1553/4
